Reviews.Title: “Terrible and but it made the trip memorable”
Reviews.Author: Alexander_tkd
Reviews.Content: two fire alarms in two nights, the stairs are like climbing Mt. Olympus! And guess what floor we were on? TOP! The rooms were clearly missing a update from when it was first build! The beds swallowed you, no joke... but It made the Amsterdam experience all worth while. 2 mins from the Pub crawl so well located!

Reviews.Title: “Too bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Manabah
Reviews.Content: beacuse it was easter holiday, the price was so expensive for the service, no wifi in my room although it is in the room description , no electricity in the room at night for two days. the room is too small and there was no wordrobe, TV is not working, the room service didn't clean the room every day with no toilet rolls. the girl in the recepition was not helpful at all with no smile. maybe the best point that the hotel is 20 minutes walk to the centre of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as everyone says.”
Reviews.Author: Emily B
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel before I knew about Trip Advisor but happened to come across the reviews a few days before my trip. Naturally I was absolutely terrified after reading all of the awful reviews. However, I was really pleasantly surprised. The location of the hotel is absolutely fantastic - a five minute walk from the Leidseplein, which is a really nice square filled with bars, restaurants, coffee shops etc. There's also a tram station there so it's really handy for catching trams to all over the city. The room itself was very simple and basic, however, it was immaculately clean and the bathroom was clearly newly fitted. The bedding was clean and soft and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast was 5 Euro each and was certainly worth it. Again it was a simple/basic breakfast, however you would be hard pressed to find something of the same price in a local cafe. All in all for the price I paid it was extremely good value for money. Either they must have had some renovations since some of the previous reviews, or I was just lucky enough to stay in one of the nicer rooms (number 18). If you're looking for somewhere cheap and cheerful that's really close to all the main attractions then this hotel is perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgriff15
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location, there is nothing else going for this place. Walls and beds were dirty. We booked an en-suite and were given a shared bathroom which was disgusting. There must be better hotels than this in Amsterdam so avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “great location for sightseeing not much else”
Reviews.Author: branstonthecat
Reviews.Content: booked triple room and double and single room , all rooms clean but poor repair, great choice of breakfast best we found for location just off the square with plenty of bars and the argentina steak house is well recommended use this hotel if you just need a bed for the night but its not luxury but it does have the local police station opposite

Reviews.Title: “so bad, i wouldn't even recommend this place to my enemies.....”
Reviews.Author: oliviacharlie88
Reviews.Content: I dont know what to say really.... if the accomadation is clean and basic... i'm happy, but this place is a joke. i had heard of the steep stairs, so i requested a ground floor room. There was four of us on a girls holiday. It took us ages to find the place.. but thats more our bad sense of direction, than there fault. there was a tram line outside our bedroom window.... it stopped at like 1 or 2 in the morning.. started again at 7 am... i was going nuts!... worst sleep ever.... Couldn't open windows.... carpet was vile.... beds were basic... This place is only for stag weekends and budget travelers. The staff were so unhelpful.. really didnt care. The breakfast of cold hard boiled eggs and cheese and bread... was edible. We had to walk outside and down the street to the reception and dining area, its in seperate building. the only plus was its central location and price..... a place i hope i never have the misfortune of staying in again...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cancelled a CONFIRMED reservation made with Hoteliers.com”
Reviews.Author: jagcat98
Reviews.Content: I had a confirmed reservation with Hoteliers.com of which I made several for the coming year with different hotels with Hoteliers.com with the same card details. After booking flights this hotel emailed me direct to say they have cancelled my booking making the excuse that my card is not valid. They did NOT ask to confirm my card details or ask for any other card of which I have or ask for me to contact them. NO JUST CANCELLED - book at this hotel and you may just find yourself on the street!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: paulima100
Reviews.Content: We booked two twin rooms in this hotel for three nights . We paid a booking deposit but after reading reviews and attempting to cancel the booking six days before our due arrival ,the hotel immediately charged the full amount of the stay for four people to the credit card. On arrival we found reception to be in another hotel across the street. On entering our rooms on the ground floor we found them to be extremely small with tiny shower rooms. The hotel in general was extremely shoddy. On complaining we were moved to slightly larger rooms but with even smaller shower rooms on the third floor with no lift and the narrowest, steepest staircase imaginable. On the first evening I attempted to leave to meet friends and found myself to be locked in as the main hall door would not open. Other guests attempting to enter from outside found the same problem. A guest informed reception who refused to come over to investigate the problem and stated that the door would eventually open if we continued to try the handle. In doing so the handle came off in my hand. The fire exit was locked with no way out and a notice saying it was locked to stop people entering. A queue of guests had gathered outside as they couldn't enter either and only when I passed the door handle through a small grid covering the glass panel in the door did reception send someone to resolve the problem, eventually fitting a new door handle. A horrible experience which ruined the holiday. No apology was tendered , in fact the staff at reception were downright rude. An expensive and unfortunate mistake in booking this hotel, approximately 170eur per person for three nights with no breakfast included. An unsafe , unpleasant hotel with unfriendly staff. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: mattiadg
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation in this hotel since we didn't know tripadvisor yet.. and on the other websites the pictures are great and everything looks ok. Reality is slightly different! The hotel is really dirty and as long as you get in you can smell that something is wrong! We run away after a couple of hours spent arguing with the manager which was very nice (he showed me four rooms to make me stay) but this hotel is absolutely not suitable for humans and should be closed by the authorities!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, don't believe the negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: VoiceOfReason83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the triple hot deal room. A bit aprehensive on arrival due to the negative feeback read on here. Don't believe the negativity, it was a nice hotel, clean, affordable, and great location, with helpful people at the front desk. No mice/rats were seen as stated in some other people's reviews (they probably left food in their rooms, inviting mice), bed sheets were clean, and so comfortable. The stairs were steep, but that's Amsterdam for you. Would definately stay here again, it was only a 2 minute walk away from Leidesplein.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: isabelgoncalves_11
Reviews.Content: There is no reason for this hotel to be classed as one on any website.It's disgusting! The reception is in another hotel across the street and we were arriving so exhausted!noboby knew where the hotel was.then we were informed by the reception staff that mice could come into the room!Jesus!disgusting!Sometimes the card key doesnÂ´t work and you have to go back to the other hotel reception.amazing! The room was very tiny, with no bedside tables, no coat hangers and a big window with not enough curtains!We had to turn off the lights to take our clothes off.The room cleaning is only every 2 days!We didni't dare to take off our socks to tread on the carpet!There was a balcony full of trash, it has not been cleaned for many weeks at least. The breakfast area is also in the other hotel,it's not big enough and if you donÂ´t come very early there will be lack of everything to eat! The location is great but noisy (near Leidseplein).I will never book with this hotel again.There are plenty of hotels and hostels at the same spot.I've stayed in several hotels before and this is by far the worst I've ever stayed in.How can hotels like this stay in business?

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: KTBlonde
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from Hotel De Lantaerne and I can honestly say I enjoyed my stay. I was slightly apprehensive prior to arrival following the past reviews on Trip Advisor. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly man on reception. As we arrived prior to check in, they allowed us to leave our luggage with the hotel (including safes for valuables), so we could go and explore Amsterdam. Leidesplein is a 5 minute walk from the hotel where you will find a number of restaurants, bars and the tram line (trams run at least every 10 minutes to Amsterdam Central and I would highly recommend purchasing the day travel pass). Upon returning to the hotel to check in, we were then provided with our room number. We were on the 3rd floor and although negotiating the stairs was a bit traumatic with our cases it's expected when staying in Amsterdam and definitely not something to complain about. The room was basic but clean and included new bedding and towels. The bathroom was a wet room, recently re-tiled and also very clean. We had a great view of the canal and although you are only a 5 minute walk away from the main square, the noise is minimal and will not keep you awake at night (we actually kept our bedroom window open throughout our stay). Breakfast is served 07:30-09:30 and (although basic) is nothing to complain about either. I can honestly say I would stay there again and will recommend to friends and family. A number of rooms have clearly been refurbished and I would therefore avoid allowing previous reviews to put you off staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: sponge87
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews we were not looking forward to staying at this hotel. On arrival we where greeted by very friendly staff who allowed us to leave our bags so we could go and explore until we could check in. The hotel also provided free lockers to store valuables. Once checked in the room we where pleasantly surprised the room was basic but clean with new beds/bedding and modern bathroom. Location was great tram stops only 2 minutes around the corner and very near Leidseplein. The hotel also provided free breakfast - this was located in the hotel across the street - once again this was basic but a lot better than the other reviews suggested. i would definitely recommend this hotel basic but reasonably priced and great location.

Reviews.Title: “ITS NOT THAT BAD”
Reviews.Author: Wannabango
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and basic. If you are just wanting a place to sleep, you cant go wrong with this hotel. The rooms are very small and basic, but they are clean. I wouldnt want to take the Mrs there but great for a lads weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore all reviews up to now.”
Reviews.Author: Slyspygb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 8 people on a stag do. Simply put it is a place to rest you head. On the way over we read the other reviews and were worried, however when we got there we were very supprised. The hotel must be under new management because they let us view the rooms before we booked in and looking at the rooms all had new beds new paint jobs new bedding... New everything. Don't expect room service or amazing facilities but look at how much you paying and why you in amsterdam anyway !?!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING - HOSTEL NOT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthless73
Reviews.Content: Lacking in any basic cleanliness, health and safety. Toilet was black, no towel refresh or housekeeping for 4 days. Extremely noisy. reception located across a very busy road. the free breakfast was a joke and would not give my dog it. the annoying thing is it was in a great location, what staff i did encounter were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “what a joke”
Reviews.Author: kellybubblefish
Reviews.Content: This hotel was totally incompetent. I made a booking a month before I was to fly out, and four days before I was to fly, they contacted me saying my card had not been accepted and I had 24hours to sort it out before they cancelled my reservation. Fair enough, I sorted the card details (turned out they wanted a different type of card) and emailed them saying if it still wasn't right, to let me know and I would use a different card. They emailed me back instantly saying the reservation had been cancelled - this was twelve hours after being notified (not the promised 24). I then rang the hotel, who explained my room had already been re-booked, and they would sort me out with two seperate rooms instead of a studio room. I paid for it on a card which was accepted, and then waited for the confirmation... which never came. Rang them the following day only to hear I had no reservations whatsoever, despite having given them my credit card details (I will have to wait to see if I have been charged or not). They then said if I turned up in Amsterdam they would sort me out a hotel when I got there. Needless to say I didn't risk the chance of being left in Amsterdam with nowhere to stay, so I luckily got a room at a hotel I've been to before (Hotel Acro s really nice. Small, but nice). This hotel is a complete joke and with the exception of an employee called Robert, who genuinely seemed to care, the hotel doesn't seem to care. I didn't get to stay there but needless to say I never will book with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations to Hotel de Lantaerne”
Reviews.Author: BettyEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I booked a short break at the Lantaerne a few years ago as a treat for my Mum. Its only endearing feature was the friendly, laid back receptionist and its location. I almost wept when we saw our room - by far the worst hotel room Ive ever seen, tiny, dirty and very smelly. We immediately went off in search of another hotel. I would rather have slept in a public toilet than spend a night there. Please take heed of other negative reviews - this hotel is truly hideous. Congratulations Hotel du Lantearne on being awarded one of the Dirtiest Hotel In Europe awards. You must be very proud.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, hot shower and a good spot in Amsterdam, what else do you need?”
Reviews.Author: sivalfa
Reviews.Content: Spend a couple of nights in this hotel and yes, we're still alive'and healthy (quite unlikely according to other reviews...). The hotel is indeed not the best hotel in the city, but then again, the prices are quite reasonable. The best part of the place is the location as it is just around the corner of the Leidseplein and within walking distance of the museums. The room is on the small side, but that is standard in Amsterdam and didn't bother us at all as we were the whole day in the city sightseeing. The room could get a do-over and the stairs are steep. But in overall, the place was quite decent and we did extend for a couple of days for a good price, so no complaints from our side.

Reviews.Title: “This should be fumigated and then demolished”
Reviews.Author: patatilla
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed there we got a room on the groud floor. It was very basic but clean and comfortable in a fantastic location. Bit noisy in the morning with lots of people coming in/going out but nothing terrible. Good enough for us to come back, and so we did! Second time is a different story though. Even before you get in, the place looks totally run down. The reception is not even there anymore, you have to cross the road and go to a nearby building. The staff are not very friendly at all (they used to be nice in the old days) and it's not even cheap! However, the worst part of it was the room itself. It was located upstairs and it's quite hard to carry any luggage, but that's Amsterdam's buildings for you so not complaining about this. When I entered the room I was quite shocked since I was expecting something like the room I had a couple of years ago. Wrong. This time, the wardrobe was broken with a door missing, one of the bedside lamps did not work, the window had a crack in it. the bed sheets were full of holes and did not fit the bed. The blankets were so old and looked so dirty. Disgusting. Still, the first night I did manage to sleep Then, on the second day, we left the room and then realised we had left my jacket upstairs so we went to get it, only to find a guy wandering in our room. He introduced himself as "the cleaner" and said that he would clean the room after we left. He had no cleaning products or uniform and we asked him to leave the room. He made a fuss about it, pointed at a blood stain on the bed, blaming us for it (I later found the stains were caused by bedbugs that had bitten us!!) and did not want to leave. The dodgy man left eventually, but we are convinced that he was trying to steal our stuff. Unluckily for him we had nothing of value in the room. Right, so we went out and came back at nightime to get some sleep before going to the airport and things just got worse. I closed my eyes and after a while I felt something crawling on me. I thought I was being paranoid so I didn't pay much attention until it happened again. Then I put my boyfriend's light on (mine wasn't working) and I found the little beasts. The bed was infested by bedbugs. I crushed at least 8 and then I decided to get up so I stayed awake all night sitting on the carpet feeling sick! This place is not suitable for humans and would not recommend it to my worst enemy. Doubt I will go back to Amsterdam in the near future too, thanks to this dump.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I Ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: jassman200
Reviews.Content: Dear All who planning to visit Amsterdam, Please do not stay at this Hotel this is an advice, which I ignored before staying at this hotel, which is without a reception, you can stay with the price I paid at a better hotel in a better area. They stole my money from the bag!!!! It is the first time in my life I feel insecure at a hotel. The breakfast is Not a real breakfast I eat their breakfast one time only and found it not worthy at all. It is a bad luck, which leads you to this hotel. regards, yousuf al zadjali

Reviews.Title: “Lay down your head”
Reviews.Author: craigybell
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to fuss about and try to make this place out to be something it clearly is not. But if like us your on a budget and all you need is somewhere to lay down your head at night with a free breakfast in the morning. We'll this is the place to go. I have read some of the other reports about this place. And really i think some people book these 1 star hotels but yet get there and expect 5 star. Why do people complain about things like the remote control did'nt work or the stairs were too steep(same in all A/dam hotels) or the bed is'nt comfy enough. These people really annoy me after all it's 1 star what do they expect. Anyway as my title says if all you want is a place to sleep we'll you really can't go wrong with here. The Mrs and i were on the top floor(4th floor) and not once did we hear any noise late night early morning. We actaully thought that this was a great hotel givin the price we paid for it. The location was just around the corner from liedseplein. But far enough away that you could'nt hear any noise. If you like to smoke they allow it and that along with the price is what made us book it. But all in all i really can't fault this little place. Yes it was'nt 5 star luxury but our room for the price was massivenm compared with some of the budget rooms in a/dam that you can't even swing a cat in. We both really enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate in going back we actually tried to book for our upcoming trip. But unfortunetly it was fully booked. So anyway as i've said somewhere to sleep free breekie in the morning locaqtion superb. You can't go wrong in booking here.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't even stay. the hotel charge us EU140 for nothing”
Reviews.Author: MatthewCheng
Reviews.Content: The room is about 9 m2 only and it's so dirty even the blanket is yellow( supposed to be white). We arrived at 13th Sep. 2010. The hotel is owner same with Marnix Hotel. They give us a tiwn room on the first floor. It's so dirty we can't even live in it. So we ask to take our money back(We didn't even stay in the room for 10 mins). But they charge us EU140 and we leave. When we were argueing with hotel, about 15 mins. another 3 people have same problem and they want their money back too. A young guy even find a rat under his pillow. And the Hotel charge him 2 more night, EU250, for early check out. Never stay in this hotel even you have no where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you, owner of Lantaerne Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChinaGuest007
Reviews.Content: Hey owner, I wonder how can u continue to run this louzy hotel after getting of so many complaints. Why you don't feel shame and to improve yourself !! I wonder if there is any Travel organisation v can send our complaints to as it completely destroy the image of such nice Amsterdam city. I booked 3 nights single room and paid 5 stars hotel price for this terrible hotel (I dont think v can call it is a hotel) which I never had such bad experience before. This louzy hotel even worse than no star hotel in China. In booking.com , it mentioned this hotel was 2 or 3 stars but indeed, there was no star there. I must say it was a minus 5 stars hotel if you wanted to classify it. The reality of this hotel was completely opposite of those photo u saw in their website. Room was dirty and arwful, no soap, bed cover did not clean for long long time, a lot of small animals in the room on carpet, bed sheet and everywhere. In the middle night I woke up, I felt something strange in my ear, fortunately I got a small animal. But I could not believe that there were many small animals came out to my bed when I woke up in the midnight. So, the whole night I could not sleep but kept watching to each other with these small guys. It's completely destroy my whole trip and even now, when i thought about this terrible experience, I really wanted to vomid. If I cannot find any room in Amsterdam in future, I will surely go to other city but will never and ever consider this Terrible Hotel again !

Reviews.Title: “Under no circumstances stay here!”
Reviews.Author: flabadob
Reviews.Content: This place was dirty and not a hotel but a squat,, there was no double glazing it was noisey from trams and people coming back from bars late at night. The rooms were not decorated and run down and the towels had holes in them. The breakfast was across the road in a hotel cellar, but I wouldnt recommend breakfast, we had to help ourselves the table wear looked unclean and we had to do our own dishes. The hotel is not a place that I would recommend to anyone, after a long time travelling we didnt even have a kettle or things to make a drink when we arrived. We stayed only one night and checked out my boyfriend found better accommodation, but it didnt start our holiday off well, I found Amsterdam noisey from the trams cafes and bars until late into the early hours, beware most hotels don't have double glazing and the older houses have staircases like climbing Everest!

Reviews.Title: “Run”
Reviews.Author: MMMDublin5
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel. We unfortunately stayed there for 5 nights in June 2010 and it completely spoiled our holiday. It is filthy and totally inadequate. Here is a list of our complaints. The keys do not always open the doors The entrance and stairways are filthy, especially the patchwork carpets. Glass in doors is cracked. Bed Matresses, boxes and rubbish bags litter the landings. The plaster and paint is falling off the walls. Inside the rooms there is patchwork carpet in places which is stained and filthy, walls are filthy, the matresses are old and saggy. The windows do not open and the curtains do not cover the windows. The furniture is too dirty to put your clothes in. The 'Bunk Beds' have no ladders and are not suitable for adults. We met 5 groups of people during our stay who complained about the standards to the operators. You have to cross a busy road to get breakfast. TV didn't work, no iron, no hairdryer..... RUN

Reviews.Title: “Staying here will absolutely ruin your trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: c0llegetraveller
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of not heeding the numerous awful reviews for this place [I am a pretty laid back college student and figured I was reading reviews from picky reviewers... THIS WAS NOT THE CASE] Please do not stay at this hotel. The exterior of the building is charming, and the location is great, but once you walk into the front door there are a few rooms in front of you in a dingy hallway and then only a stairway down to the creepy basement where the rest of the rooms are located. We were terrified of our rooms, one opened up onto a scary patio/window-well packed with trash, and then other had a barred window at sidewalk level. The bathroom lights wouldn't turn on, and the beds were purely the most hideous, thin, and bed-bug infested you could find [our group wound up with many bites]. We wound up trying to stay out of this 'hotel' as much as humanly possible on our trip, and coming back at night made us sad and depressed. I literally could not paint a more accurate picture of the hotel than to say it is hardly fit for humans to walk inside nonetheless sleep there. It is worth ANY expense to avoid this experience. They also told us we could get free parking if we parked on this random street extremely far away and we ended up getting a hefty ticket for parking there... when we checked in there was a list of reasonably priced parking lots hanging next to the check-in desk which the worker had neglected to mention....

Reviews.Title: “So incredibly bad I we could not believe it-”
Reviews.Author: nowunhappy
Reviews.Content: The booking firm we used to book the hotel wouldn't let us upload our review to their site (they said for technical reasons) even though we tried to warn them the hotel was so bad that we wanted others who were going to book to know- so the agent was not good for us at all- after we had paid them the money (Easyto book.com)- Heres our complaint top them in full. Problems- In order of importance: When we checked in at front desk the staff gave us a credit card slip to sign- which had a 5% surcharge fee included by them. I questioned that we reserved (booked) via easytobook and that on the booking confirmation we had made there was no mention of extra 5 percent (I showed them the print out of the webpage booking concerned) They matter of factly said- we have to take it up the easyto book- i.e it was not their (the hotels) problem and that it was their (the hotel's) policy to add this booking charge(very unhappy- but had to sign the credit slip as we needed the room obviously- ((only 15.00 euros more- but it was on principal I complained) Spoke to another couple at breakfast who went via another agent- the hotel charged them the extra too- they were not happy as it didn't say about the 5 percent on that agents order page either. I escalated it and said I wanted the owner/manager to explain- the staff said he would tell us the same thing. We were also very unhappy with the room they provided- we booked a two bed room and they gave us a room with three camp beds in it- not proper beds- but just rickety camp beds one that occasionally collapsed. The fact there was three camp beds meant there was only a tiny space to walk around in the room. The room was very dirty also -the floor didn't look cleaned and the bed spreads were grubby and dead bugs next to the wall. No soap in the room either. dust over most things and holes all over the curtains. For our stay there they completely forgot to clean and service our room. No hoovering. Breakfast- while the selection of food was great- ( no complaints there) the water for the tea making had bugs and dust floating on the surface- changed once I pointed it out.The plates were also dirty as were virtually all the cups- the milk jugs were caked in old milk too- hadn't been washed for a while. A side issue- was that on the De lanternes webpage- it says all 28 rooms have private facilities including showers -toilets etcs- not the case- many rooms have shared bathrooms- on arrival at the hotel we had to actually almost kick and push the front door open as it was jammed- when we eventually got in- the receptionist gave us an ear bashing saying there was no problem with the door- after our 15 hour flight I explained that both my wife and I had tried it but it wouldn't open- she held firm saying the door was fine- (good start) Due to stress on the part of my wife- she asked me to promise not to make a scene and complain- she wanted to let the problems go- ( I said I would take it up with easytobook on my return) I would be grateful to hear your views on the hotel and whether you think they deserve a place in your listings-" again the agents reply was can't upload the review for technical reasons-

Reviews.Title: “Please, go somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: Deko85
Reviews.Content: Yes, I know I was traveling throughout Europe with not so much money, but I regret every penny I saved staying at this hotel...If I had stayed somewhere else paying twice as much, I would not have regretted it and I would surely have been more satisfied. Rooms are filthy...paint on the walls peeling off, stains everywhere on the carpet, broken window, disaster! Also, the tiny bathroom is disgusting and dirty. When I went to my room (2nd floor) and took the stairs, I felt like climbing Everest! The stairs were so inclined I thought I was going to fall back and roll over everyone right behind me. And what an interior! As dark and bealtiful as my basement. One good thing, people at the front desk and (small) restaurant for breakfast were nice. Please if you can afford paying a few more euros, go find some other place. I am sure you will not regret it! Even for backpacking!

Reviews.Title: “CRAPPIEST HOTEL IN LIFE HISTORY”
Reviews.Author: kayque
Reviews.Content: - Paid cash 50 eur a night. Crappy hotel, dirty carpet in room, stains on the bed cover sheets, toilet not working properly, leaves remains when flushing including toilet paper, stains on shower curtain, wall and floor (may get an mushroom, foot infection because of the dirtyness) small tv with lousy quality. Clothing cabinet looked like an outside bathroom with rats living in it. Giant hole on the side of the floor facing away from bed. Hard bed!!! The whole hotel room was shaking everytime the bus went by, Window not properly sealed could hear people whisper outside. + Nice hotelstaff

Reviews.Title: “Prison would be better......”
Reviews.Author: Stargazer33
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived and got to the hotel and there reception was in another hotel across the street the hotel marnix. We checked in and there wa a problem with the booking they had charged us for 3 rooms instead of 2 and refused to refund my friend who's credit card we had used to book everything. The rooms were a disgrace I was on the third floor when i got to the room it actually smelled like fecies and then my friends who hadn't seen there room yet came up and nearly died when they saw the and smelled room. My friends finally got into there room and the bed now this is the part i find so unreal the base was from a single bed and they had put a double matress on top i couldn't believe it I have never seen a business this badly run down thats still running. We did manage to change our rooms and get two "nicer" rooms on the ground floor. the other problem was getting back into the hotel as our card keys sometimes worked for the front door but not your room and vise versa or it didn't work at all.. All in all I did have a good trip I just didn't spend alot of time at the hotel unless i needed to sleep...I would not recommend this place to anyone it is an absolute dive of a place I wouoldn't even put pigs in it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is filthy, damp, and they will rip you off!”
Reviews.Author: MNH0109
Reviews.Content: I made an online reservation at the hotel de lantaerne for the first night of my honeymoon. When I arrived, they told us to come back at 3pm when the room would be ready. When we returned, they did not have the room I reserved but showed me 3 others that were so filthy, in disrepair, damp and generally disgusting, that I refused to stay there and asked for a refund. They refused to give me a refund unless I gave them all of my bank account information! Then they told me if i could find another hotel in amsterdam, then they would provide a refund. I am disputing the charges with my credit card company - but don't have high hopes of getting my money back. Don't be fooled, this place is no hotel - more like bottom of the barrel hostel that's only suitable if you are 16 year old traveling with 8 friends and its all you can afford. buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPodkarpacie
Reviews.Content: Only truth is the location of the hotel and that they take money first.Everthing was dirty.Our room was smal, only with beds /my bed had broken leg/, one ruined chair and never cleaned litle table.The cleaner never used the vaccum cleaner during our stay in the hotel.The windows didn't open wide,lucky because noise from the very traffic street and young people who spent nigthtime infront the building ruined every nighttime. Bathroom do not belive to the foto!!!! Diry ,never cleaned,with a smel of the fungi.Wet and fungi was on the wall in the bedroom. Breakfast was rather good but every day the same ,very repetitive if someone stay longer.Better to find other hotel in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Utterly disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: ohgirl99
Reviews.Content: The website claims that every room comes with a WC, TV and phone. This is not true. The TV did not work, there was no phone in the room, and the telephone in the lobby had broken, we were told, "Sometime last week." We had to walk five blocks to a pay phone in the Leidseplein. It didn't appear that any steps were being taken to repair the broken phone, and it didn't even have an "out of order" sign on it. The bathroom door didn't open all the way, for hitting the bed. There was dry rot all around the door frame and floor, from the fact that the shower wasn't contained in any way. There was one shower curtain along one side, to keep people from showering while sitting on the toilet, apparently, but the rest was just open water flowing all over the place. The room was sweltering, dirty, and the sheets didn't fit the bed, so we were sleeping on bare mattress. The wallpaper was wrinkled and peeling. I would only recommend this place as a flophouse for college kids so wasted they don't care if they come home with a bedbug infestation. It's only a couple of blocks from party central in the Leidseplein. We found a cheaper place in de Pijp that was gorgeous, a little boutique hotel called Hotel Aalborg. Very sweet, with a fabulous bathroom and cute view. Not so many drunk American frat boys, and a much cooler neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad as reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: dutchguy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 1 night as it was the cheapest on a Booking site. I paid just 35 Euro for a single, but got a double (room 18) on arrival. I had to pay cash in advance. Their PIN machine did not work. Stairs are steep, you have to climb either 33, 49, 65 or 81 steep steps to reach your room. For the price I paid I cannot complain really. Room had new nice curtains, small TV with lots of channels and I could plug my headphone in for good sound. Large low bed, not too comfortable mattress but OK. Good furniture, looked new. Window could open but you have to do it yourself, the knob does not work. Small bathroom, but clean. I think it will get hot in there in summer but they will have ventilators. There were stains on the carpet but not their fault that they get such dirty guests. At the entrance are boxes for your valuables so the ones who complained about stealing could have prevented it, IF it really happened. It costs 20 Euro but you get it back. Also 10 Euro for the keycard which you get back at checkout. Good breakfast, nothing less than what everyone eats at home normally, but no yoghurt. Nice terrace at the canal. No phones in room (but everyone has cell phones nowadays), no minibar, a very small desk, one chair. This is not a bad hotel, but it IS for backpackers or people not used to real luxury. If you expect too much, go elsewhere and don't pay more than say 60 Euro, otherwise it is too much. Do a good search at booking sites like www.booking.com and if you find this hotel to be the cheapest (like me) and you need that, then you will be OK. I was only disturbed by young people screaming outside all night, but that's not their fault. A room on the front is best as the back is towards Leidseplein and 20 meters from Melkweg. They have no real luggage room but I left mine in the reception and that was fine. You can reach the hotel by going on tram 1,2 or 5 from Central Station, get off at Leidseplein, walk round the theatre and then it is at the canal, about 300 meters. Very nice staff and most importantly, THEY HAVE A NEW OWNER since 2 weeks. .

Reviews.Title: “Disgustingly disappointed!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MISS_ASHLEIGH
Reviews.Content: * Snorkel needed when attemtping to have a shower (Dont bring the cat) * Bring your own towels and linen as they do not change them * Breakfast restricted to 1 each of the following, Hard boiled egg, plastic cheese slice, Ham and 2 slices of toast * Heating only on during the day, freezing at night * The aroma brought back fond memories of last summers trip to a pig farm in Venezuala.......mmmm nice! * Photos on website have been air brushed more than Jordons breasts * on a postive, good location & friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “CAUTION! They're thieves”
Reviews.Author: John5486
Reviews.Content: Don't make the same mistake as we had! They ruined our vacation. Room service picked in our bags and stole money â€“ 250 euro, left us with some money hoping we won't notice!! But we had, and then we went to talk with the guy on reception, which turned out as a big liar. They even admitted the theft... And after a while when I asked to speak with management he refused. As he got scared and started behaving like a monster. Anywayâ€¦ it's not worth the risk the attitude is really bad breakfast is lame and you don't want to be there in winter time, cause they turn off the heating in the rooms, probably to save some more moneyâ€¦ So, if you gotten till here I'll give you another tip â€“ there are plenty of chip, kind and worm hostels at the same spot, for example â€“ "Marnix hotel", "Hotel Impala", "Freeland hotel", "Backstage hotel"â€¦ Don't believe their lies, they probably write fake comments about the hotel in order to rip some more money from poor peopleâ€¦ Thanks for your time and good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hostel experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: nicolem6
Reviews.Content: Not only were we suprised by how much the hostel cost for such an unclean and small place, but we also had money stolen from our suitcases and when we reported it the management suggested that we were probably stoned or drunk, neither which is true. The receptionist said it was impossible for something to be stolen since it is a family run business but i think if anything it is more likely because if you are related to the owner it is less likely he will fire you for stealing. The bathrooms were awful and i almost killed myself 10 times on the extremely narrow stairs. Reception was beyond rude and the only nice thing about this place was the location but i would rather stay 30 minutes outside of the city than have to deal with this "family" business.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky”
Reviews.Author: CJG82
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It's not good to write reviews as lists but otherwise this would just be a rant from beginning to end. 1. The hotel smells like a sewer, in the reception, in the halls and in the rooms. 2. The rooms are dirty, the bathrooms are dirtier. 3. The breakfast area is only big enough to seat 10% of the hotel guests. We were advised to be down on the dot of 7 o'clock "if we want to eat". Please don't forget this is a Â£90 a night hotel, not a hostel. It's not in a central location and I'm not expecting any frills. What I do expect is a hotel that does not stink of [-] and a clean room and bathroom. How can hotels like this stay in business?

Reviews.Title: “absolute disgrace”
Reviews.Author: bobbyosullivan
Reviews.Content: First things first i know were in Holland and should expext steep stairs but they were a hazard you could barely fit your whole foot on a step, we had to pay them a deposit just to use the hair dryer, the double bed was just two singles pushed together, it was non smoking with penalty charges on your credit card if you dissobeyed, when you had a shower it flooded the whole toilet and last but not least there was a brown stain on the middle of one of the beds.... you can guess what it looked like. And all this for E98 a night, what a rip off, there would have been much better standards in a hostel

Reviews.Title: “Terrible i found excrement on the sheets”
Reviews.Author: hanno123
Reviews.Content: Me and Two friends stayed in a triple room this year and it was teh most traumatic experience of my life after a pleasant day of galavanting around the RLD Me and my chums decided to retire to our rooms for some backgammon, however upon entering "Sarlacks Pit" we noticed the room had a musty odour we heard screams of anguish coming from the bathroom and my friend lance said he had turned the tap on and excrement was coming out of the sink assuming it was blocked we tried to fix it but decided to leave it until the next day at around 2 Am a smell groped my sleeping body i turned the lights on and my pillow and sheets had more excrement on i complained to the desk who said they would sort it in the morning and told me it was late and i should try to get some sleep so i had to sleep in the wardrobe, the second day lance feel down the stairs which were like mount everest and damaged his leg therefore ruining our plan for that night in the RLD, the breakfast was awful and the waiter often broke wind as he handed us our food and plates, th eone plus was the vista from our window until i noticed 2 men one urinating and one throwing up against the wall just feet below us all in all i was dissapointed in the extreme i wanted a nice fun getaway and in th eend i stayed in a smutty back door shambles of a place, one mor ething i must add to travellers this place is dangerous the area is full of drugs and many loals were surprised you can stay in thsi area also the doors on the rooms have no locks and you are advised to take all possesions with you including luggage all day!!!! AVOID !

Reviews.Title: “The worst place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hedany
Reviews.Content: We are a retired couple and it was our 5th visit to The Netherland. After 10 enjoyable days we arrived to Amsterdam for 5 days (4 night) prior to flying back home. We made reservation at this hotel sibce the web page was very promissing. Upon arrival the the "hole" calling itself a "hotel" we knew we made a horibale mistake. The reception is located in a cellar. The room was extrimly small, noisy, no air-condition; no telephone, no ventillation' window could not be opened' bathroom which include the toilet was with out ventilation causing all smells to be in the room and you have to seat sideway on the toilet seat because it was so small (see pictures) There was nor room to put our laggage and to enter the bad one have to climb over an other. The "breakfast room" in the cellar was dairty, sticky, unvintelated and food was a joke.... We decided to run away but their policy is 48 hours advanced notice. After 2 sleepless night we run away from this "hole" which is not intened for the stay of humanbeings !!! The only positive point is the location of this place.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: flaresBrighton
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, this hotel is in a fantastic location for you to explore some of the essential attractions amsterdam has to offer. Anne Franks House is about a 15minute walk, (try and get there early to safe waiting in a very long queue). Check out the lovey cafe adjacent to the museum also. The Van Gogh Museum is also about 15 min walk and the Rijksmuseum. You will be in a place called Liedesplein which is like a mini slice of London's West End in the evening, there are some very good restaurants, (fantastic greek restaurant called Mykonos) and bars and clubs if that's what you're looking for. It's incredibly easy to get around, 5 minutes from the hotel the tram service will connect you to many places around amsterdam. It takes around 15 minutes to Central Station, and a further 15 to Schipol airport. The staff are very friendly and helpful, little problems were attended to, i.e.to change a light bulb, needing more towels etc. The breakfast is certainly fine to get you started for your day. It's a 'help-youself' service to toast, a selection of preservatives, boiled eggs, slices of cheese, ham, coffee, tea. You can have as much as you wish. Lovely views of the canals from the bedroom window, there is also a locker service to put your passports, valuables in for a deposit of â‚¬20 (refundable) which is worth using. On the negative side, don't expect the Hilton! When you first enter your room it maybe a little grim. Old carpets, stained, very old tatty 1940's wall paper. The rooms could do with a little more va va voom. Also, be prepared for the smallest bathrooms in the world. If your tall, you may struggle using the toilet with the limited leg room, but you'll manage. Our twin room had a toilet, sink and shower. However, the shower is powerful and has constant hot water day and night. Not a fault of the hotel, just archictecture in amsterdam generally, be prepered for the very steep, narrow, and at first rather intimidating stairs you will have to negotiate. If you have any physical ailments, it may be best to ask for a room on the first floor. The walls are rather thin and you can hear other people walking up and down the stairs, or even in their rooms. If your a light sleeper, take some ear plugs just in case. However generally we found it quiet and a pleasure to sleep. To sum, this is a low budget hotel, in which its highlight is the prime location. It's relatively clean, your linen and towels will be changed, good breakfast. It's only a place to sleep and eat because you'll be out exploring Amsterdam for most of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Where is my money?”
Reviews.Author: neskuchaj
Reviews.Content: In the end of april i booked this hostel by internet for one day.And when i come,a girl on reception told me,that there is no money on my credit card,and asked my to pay cash.When i come back home,i call to the credit card service,and they told me,that my credit is good,and the hotel de Lantaerne blocked 60 euro.Why they blocked money,if i payed cash?Give me back my money,pilferers! Mr.Mikhail Linev

Reviews.Title: “Respect my privacy.”
Reviews.Author: TrippyRome
Reviews.Content: When I book a low budget hotel I don't expect a five star room or service: the room was simple, not perfectly clean, but big for Amsterdam standards; the bathroom was really small and the shower didn't have a curtain, and it was impossible to not flood all. But the thing that bother me really was the housekeeping service. The waitress never knocked before entering the room and once she found me naked after the shower (it was impossible to avoid embarassing situations because she didn't came never at the same time). Also, when she cleaned the room while we were out, she always left the door open. Luckly the only valuable thing that I had was only the camera, that i carried with me everyday, so nothing was missed, but this isn't a good excuse for that unforgivable negligence.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but bring warm clothes!”
Reviews.Author: Spiral_uk
Reviews.Content: For a 4 bedroom room for the cost of about 17.50GBP per person, we couldn't go far wrong. Rooms were provided with a free towel (remember to hang these to dry, as they are not changed) and the breakfast was a nice and simple (toast and boiled eggs). Staff were friendly, but we were left not knowing what the hostel had to offer at all, and so did not use any of the services. The hostel is only a short walk from the Van Gogh museum and the Anne Frank House. If you plan on going in the winter, our radiators gave out very little heat indeed, so take your sleeping bag liners or extra layers!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: rachielass
Reviews.Content: We read lots of bad reveiws about this hotel before we got there, we were absolutly dreading it. The hotel/hostel is in Leidseplein, its less then a 2 minute work from a tram stop/cafes/resteraunts/night clubs/pubs/shops. There were 9 of us staying, we had two roms which were directly above each othere [we all had a key which got us into both rooms] both rooms had 5 beds. The rooms were cleaned every other day, we got clean towels everyday also. The staff were freindly enough, we had a back yard with table and chairs downstairs and upstairs we had a balcony. Both rooms had 2 bedrooms, a seperate bathroom and toilet room. We did have a mice run through our room once, but to be fare we had the back door wide open and food scattered all around our room. I would definetly definetly stay here again. For a 2 star hostel/hotel and the price we paid we were all very very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, considering the price”
Reviews.Author: DaddyLonglegs85
Reviews.Content: We booked two double rooms for three nights in June, which worked out at only 530 euro between the four of us. Both rooms, although small, were clean and tidy with comfortable beds. The en-suite WCs were tiny, but they beat sharing a shower-room with a bunch of complete strangers at a youth hostel. The reception staff were all friendly enough, and like everyone else in The Netherlands they spoke perfect English. We didn't ever have breakfast in the hotel so I'm afraid I can't comment on the food, but it did smell good! One word of caution, though; if you go to the hotel's own website, don't use the location map, which somehow they've managed to get wrong. The hotel is on Leidsegracht, but it's actually on the corner with Marnixstraat, just off the Leidesplein. This is a great location; pretty central with all the usual tourist sights within easy walking distance, and regular trams from Leidesplein if you're lazy. So yah, in summary; a good budget hotel in a great location, perfectly okay for a cheap place to sleep on a student citybreak. We'd all stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: starlight1968sg
Reviews.Content: My family consisting of 9 members arrived this hotel on the evening of 5th Jun 2007. A male staff was manning the reception. He was friendly and polite. During our short stay in this hotel, he allowed us to boil water, use the dinning area and kitchen. We needed to prepare our own food as we have young kids whom needed special diets. Though this hotel is old and the rooms are small, what impressed us is the additional and personal touch given by this male staff. My mother was unwell. I seeked help from him. Although the medicine in the first aid box was limited, he specially brewed thick coffee for us. He was very caring, understanding and attentive to the needs of the guests. This is what a guest needs especially when overseas. He has done an excellent job. (PS: I am sorry that I could not remember his name)

Reviews.Title: “A mouse ran across the floor!”
Reviews.Author: ec568
Reviews.Content: Booked through STA. When we opened the door to our room, a mouse scampered across the floor! It ran into the room somewhere, instead of out, so we complained and were moved to a different room. New room was decent, but the bathroom was awful. There was a shower head in the wall, but no separation between it and the rest of the bathroom (not even a curtain), therefore, every time we took a shower the entire bathroom got wet. Also, since the hotel is in a typical row house, the stairs are very steep and there is no elevator. Climbing and descending several flights of stairs to your room is not for the faint hearted. Overall, I would say that you can find a better hotel for the price we were paying!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: robins_35
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel for three nights as part of a cheap city break during the Easter holidays. The price of the room was 255 euros including breakfast and the city tourist tax, which was very reasonable for the area, especially since the rooms are all en-suite. The room was small and basic although we were out pretty much all day every day so only needed the room for a comfortable place to sleep. However, the bathroom was a little problematic as the shower emptied far slower than it filled which meant we almost flooded the bathroom on a couple of occasions. Overall, it's a good, cheap place to stay in Amsterdam and it was in a nice area near Leidsplein. The hotel was also very close to a tram stop where the number 1, 2, or 5 tram could take you to Dam Square or the Central Station very quickly which was very convenient, especially aftter a long day.

Reviews.Title: “brill”
Reviews.Author: jooolzBuryLancs
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights and had a right laugh, we only slept in the rooms, what a laugh trying to get up the stairs after some space cake, breakfast was brill staff nice and friendly, not a mouse in sight, perfect location, will definately book to go there again

Reviews.Title: “Better than a Blackpool B+B”
Reviews.Author: Jemc
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go and see family in the city and enjoy the Queen Mothers Birthday weekend at the same time. We wanted a change from staying with the family but wanted to be central to join in the party and see the relatives. Nearly every hotel we tried was booked up or way to expensive and de Lantaerne was cery cheap and available. With this in mind we booked expecting a Blackpool B+B standard but could believe our eyes when we got there. It was really chilled out, nice and tidy much cleaner than any Blackpool hotel (Im from there so have seen a few) and with a really great location. We use it regularly to visit family if we are planning a party break in the city. If you are a fussy traveller stay away- leave it free for down to earth folk.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: AMB079
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation to stay in this hotel for two nights. Two days prior to my arrival they called to tell me that they only took bookings for three nights over the weekend. I explained ad nauseum that they took my booking for two nights and thus should honor it. They refused. I sucked it up, told them I'd pay for an extra night I wouldn't use, at which point - get this - they told my reservation had been canceled the day before. To top it all off they charged my credit card for a no-show on my original arrival date! Outrageous!

Reviews.Title: “this is a good value, decent hostel, recommended :)”
Reviews.Author: cosmia
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hostel 3 nights - 2 nights at the beginning of our holiday in a triple room & our last night in a double room. The first room was on the 4th floor - im glad i dont suffer from vertigo! - it did add to the amsterdam experience but wasnt great for my arthritic knee, but hey, you expect tall buildings in amsterdam. second room was in an adjoining building, room faced the street which was a wee bit noisy but a very comfortable room. both rooms were clean, with tv and ensuite, and really close to leidseplein. it was great to be able to come back to the room, chill out have a smoke & a beer & watch odd dutch tv! i was delighted at the standard of accomodation especially considering the price, and will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: mjs999
Reviews.Content: we booked 2 double rooms. when we arrived, we were told we had to pay up front which we did, when we entered our rooms, what a shock, the rooms were nothing like the ones shown on the internet and I could not believe that people stayed in them, the toilet was broken, the bedding was dirty and covered in holes, the wall light was hanging off the wall and the window opened everytime you opened the door to your room. We complained and was basically told that we had already paid and tough. I have been e-mailing Sultan, the owner and he could not care less, stating that the hotel has now been renovated and we cannot complain, it WAS NOT renovated when we stayed. I would not have kennelled my three dogs in the rooms they were disgusting. The top floor has no fire escape and is so steep, you need oxygen when you get to the top, the carpet sticks to your feet and basically the place needs demolishing. if you want to stay in a totally run down [--], then this is your place, we walked out of the dump and stayed at IBIS hotel which was absolutely superb. DO NOT STAY IN THIS HELL HOLE

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the bad reviews! WE LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: specialguessed
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel, (which is very very competitively priced) my girlfriend and I we shocked to see lots of bad reviews. I don't know what the other people were expecting from a hotel that charges about Â£17 a night, but we thought this place was lovely. Yes there are no lifts (but derrr, you're in Amsterdam, everywhere has very steep stairs and no lifts) but the exercise will do you good (we were on the 4th floor...that's 83 stairs :) The room was clean and warm, the breakfast was filling (toast, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, jam, coffee etc) and the people were friendly. If you're expecting all mod cons then makes sure you go somewhere that charges you 3 or 4 times more. I will definitely be going back here, the location was great, and you can smoke in your room :) We have already recommended it to some friends and are looking forward to going again at easter. Please ignore all the other reviews that seem to be written by fairweather travellers. For the money, you really can't go wrong with this place. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: dolly5
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late to the hotel but got checked in very quickly and paid up front. Please be aware that there is no lifts in this hotel and if you have large suitcases you will struggle up the very very steep stairs!! The rooms are small but we were out most days so to sleep in they were fine, we got clean towels everyday but i do admit the rooms could do with a fresh lick of paint and new bathrooms as there is a few chipped tiles and mould on the walls, and after 3days in the room the bathroom smelt really bad from the drain in the shower. The location of the hotel to dam sq is about 20mins walk away but about 5mins away from some good bars and restaurants. The hotel is opposite the police station but we very rarely heard sirens from there and most of the rooms have nice views of the canal. For what i paid i don't think i would go back it is a basic hotel, amsterdam is fantastic though.

Reviews.Title: “A mouse in the room...”
Reviews.Author: Tuline
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day trip to Amsterdam. We chose to stay in a 2 stars hotel. We arrived around 1pm, the receptionist was wearing a jogging suit (it looked like a pyjama!!), walking around without shoes on, half sleepy, with a horrible look and she was smoking cigarettes!!! she told us that we can leave our bags and come back later for check in because the room was not ready. We paid in advance $100 per night for a room. There was 3 employees when we returned to pick up the keys in the evening, one of them was playing cards, the other one was playing games on the computer and the third one was checking his email, they didn't react when we came in and didn't look at us!! we asked them twice for the keys, they gave us the keys without any explanation (breakfast time, room location, etc...). They didn't even bother to show us that the room was in a building few blocs away from the main hotel building and entrance. We manage to find the building by ourselves and we were shocked to found out that the room was underground (TV command not working...) with a small window giving to the main street. We couldn't sleep at night because it was noisy outside, drunk young people chatting loud and breaking bottles of beers... The next morning we realized that our chocolate bags were eaten and we notice that there was mouse (--) next to the bags (see following taken picture), what an awful feeling!! The receptionist insisted that there was no vacant room, then changed her mind when my husband warned her that i am pregnant and that we will complain and report her to the online travel agent, she was afraid and apologized for smoking and she finally gave us another room without reimbursing the first night!! The room was less than OKAY. Overall I would say this is probably the worst hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday and I am not at all fussy! I can only not complain about their breakfast , it wasn't that bad... Tuline and Nicolas Tribut

Reviews.Title: “3 dees”
Reviews.Author: jackienc
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to Amsterdam and my sister and brother in law's first trip. We booked the hotel from the internet and had great difficulty in booking two rooms with facilities due to a concert by Madonna and a football match. We finally booked at de Lantaerne 2 rooms but had our misgivings about it being only one or two star. We arrived Monday 04 in the afternoon and was charged E 345 for four nights. We were handed the keys to Room 18 and Room 40. Our misgivings were right. The rooms are small, not very clean and desperately in need of decoration. The beds and bedding are very shabby as is everything else at the hotel. Room 40 was top of the house in the attic, just a double bed and tiny bathroom, no cupboards or wardrobes. We complained immediately, and whilst they were able to move us the next day to room 7 next to reception, we endured one night in what I can only describe as a cell. Room 7 was equally shabby as was the bathroom, although there was always hot water. The dining room is equally shabby and served the same cold breakfast every morning without fail, the only hot items were coffee, water for tea and toast from a toaster that occasionally worked, oh and cold hard-boiled eggs. We would not recommend a trip to this hotel, you would do better going to a student hostel . MR & MRS NOLAN-CLARKE

Reviews.Title: “What a dump.......”
Reviews.Author: diams
Reviews.Content: Similarly to the girls from Scotland who have left recent reviews for this hotel we endured a torrid time whilst staying here for my Stag Do. We were crammed in 6 persons to a room at a rate of 55 Euros per person meaning 330 Euros per room per night (We could have gotten a 4 starfor that money rather than this cess pit). The rooms were so small that 6 beds could not actually fit so there were at least 2 mattresses on the floor in each room crammed inbetween the beds with absolutley no other floor space. There were no wardrobes or draws so each persons bag had to stay on their bed even whilst sleeping. This meant that you had to climb over other mattresses/beds to reach your own. We had a party of 23 people and as we arrived at 8pm on a Friday night there was no real opportunity to argue as we were never going to find anywhere else for that many people at such short notice. The bathrooms walls were covered in mould, windows did not lock (we were at street level and in the basement, both of which could easily be accessed from outside), the barbed-wire covered balcony was a nice touch. On the second day a number of guys decided to find somehere else and so left the hotel. The manager insisted that they had to pay for the second night even though they were not staying and then blocked everyone else's room cards until the money was paid. After several hours of arguing they finally agreed to reinstate the cards. However, since we have returned home my credit card has been charged by the hotel claiming that we still owe for the guys who did not stay but they actually charged an extra approx 50%. I lodged a formal complaint to the booking agents asking the hotel to justify this charge but they simply replied with a number of false claims against us including that we had urinated over our beds and floor and stole all of the room cards, both complete lies. They offered no justification for the extra cost and point blank refused to cancel the charge.... The booking agents have become so embarressed by the whole debacle that they have actually paid me the additional charge back out of their own pockets. The manager of the agency has said that they have been using this hotel without any serious problems for years but that new management has taken over in the past few months and that there have been non-stop issues ever since. They have now cancelled this hotel from their list and advised other agents to do the same. This is by no means a full list of the problems we experienced but I am loathe to spend any more time because of this hotel but just wish to make sure nobody else has to go through what we did. All I can say is you would be best to avoid at all costs, I have attached some photos to show the state of the room and bathroom wall....

Reviews.Title: “hen weekend hotel nighmare!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend booked the hotel for her hen weekend. When we got there, they said they had no record of the booking we had made for 2 rooms. My friend then had to prove she had made the booking by calling her boyfriend back in the UK. Eventually they said they had our booking, but the rooms we booked were not available. We were put in a room for 5 and one person had to sleep on the floor. They charged us full rate. We had a groundfloor room and the window locks were broken. The shower/bathroom was mouldy. My friend has found out this week that they have taken extra money off her credit card. The customer service was really poor and the rooms we had were not very nice.

Reviews.Title: “terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here for a hen weekend. First they messed up the booking so we arrived on Friday to be told we were not booked in. They were very unhelpful and I had to phone my boyfriend back in Scotland to confirm the booking. They then made us pay the same amount for a shared room for 5, as 2 rooms for 2 and 3. The room was terrible, one bed was a mattress on the floor, the showerroom was mouldy. To top this off, they have taken a charge on my credit card which was used to hold the room. The staff were unhelpful and I ended in tears over the mix up.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rinky-tinky
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from 3 nights in amsterdam on a stag weekend. we stayed at the lantaerne, there were 15 of us in total and the hotel was very welcoming to a large group. The hotel is located in the centre of the nightlife, with easy access to the tram. It has clean bed sheets and towels every day, the staff are extremely nice, always similing and helped us with directions etc. The hotel was very cheap compared to other hotels in amsterdam, it was more like the price of a hostel than a hotel. It was definately great value for money, very basic in every way, but a brlliant place to stay if you just want somewhere to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AlexGreenTen
Reviews.Content: What's that saying... you get what you pay for? This hotel / hostel is in a brilliant location only a few minutes walk away from all the great eateries and bars and the tram stop. It's about 10 minutes walk from the heineken brewery and even less to the Hard Rock cafe. The staff are SO helpful and the breakfast is just what you need to set you up for the day (bread / toast, ham, cheese, salami, jams, coffee etc). The beds were really comfy and was a great nights sleep. The only problem was the decoration in the rooms - a bit of damp on the floor and ceilings 'cause they haven't water-proofed the shower rooms. The stairs are REALLY steep - so you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked four nights at the Lantaerne but left after two. The staff were quite nice and the lobby cat was cute and friendly, but the room was unacceptable. Younger people and backpackers would probably tolerate the room. First, the stairs (no elevator) are very steep and narrow. The room was tiny, the carpet was worn, there were exposed electrical wires hanging from the ceiling, the bed was old and uncomfortable, the hook where the shower head hung was broken so we had to use one hand to hold the shower head when showering, and there was no shower stall so the water fell to the floor of the tiny bathroom where it drained out. The hotel is located in a fun and busy area, but with no a/c and the window open, we heard revellers all night long. A canal-view room cost 85 Euros (about $100) and included a basic cold cut and bread breakfast. Rooms without a canal view were 80 Euros. They charge a few Euros more if you pay by credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the website”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lantaerne is not the greatest hotel on this planet. The location is pretty good and if you are only just looking for a place to sleep this is the place for you. It would make a big difference if they could at least vacuum the hotel every once in a while. The beds are about 20 years old and don't expect any nicely decorated rooms. The bathroom is minute and there are no shower curtains so you end up with a nice wet bathroom everytime you take a shower. The biggest dissapointment is the fact that the photos on their website tell a very different story all together. If you are looking for value for money - this hotel is not for you. Amsterdam is great - this hotel is NOT.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Katrinia
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here in September on our trip to Amsterdam. The location of the hotel was AWESOME. You couldn't be located closer to the party!!! We loved the location. The hotel.... eh.... it is not a nice hotel, but it is reasonably priced and the sheets were clean. The rooms were small, the carpet old, and the wallpaper was peeling a bit in our room, but it was very clean. Make sure you get a room with a canal view, otherwise the sun will be beating in the window. We slept with the window open. It was not loud. There were no bugs. I would stay here again. It's a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A dump with a great location”
Reviews.Author: susan822
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was a dump. It was summer, it smelled bad, bugs were a problem since there are no screen in the windows (you have to leave them open since no a/c). The people running the place are great and friendly and it could not be in a better location, the breakfast was very good, they have a nice bar and deck to sit out on. This would be a jewel if they put in screens, used a little bleach in the bathroom and replaced the very smelly carpet.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Lantaerne
HotelInfo.Address: Leidsegracht 111, Amsterdam 1017 ND, The Netherlands
